fields.description:
Arrow will trigger compiler errors in (at least) gcc7, gcc8 and gcc9 on aarch64 on a https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/c6/ instance.
Compiling with clang-11 works fine.

```
../src/arrow/compute/kernels/scalar_cast_nested.cc: In function ‘void arrow::compute::internal::CastListExec(arrow::compute::KernelContext*, const arrow
::compute::ExecBatch&, arrow::Datum*) [with Type = arrow::LargeListType]’:                                                                              ../src/arrow/compute/kernels/scalar_cast_nested.cc:33:6: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 void CastListExec(KernelContext* ctx, const ExecBatch& batch, Datum* out) {
      ^~~~~~~~~~~~
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.                                                                                                                See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-7/README.Bugs> for instructions.
```

Full build log attached.
fields.summary: build failure on aarch64 with -DARROW_PYTHON=ON and gcc

comments.body: It might be a valid gcc bug, but it may still be great if arrow can workaround the bug and if one of the arrow maintainers can report the bug to gcc as you are more familiar with the code
[~bkietz] [~apitrou] Could take a look at this? ARROW-8113 may be related.

[~lausen] You would need to produce the preprocessed source file and mention the precise gcc version and environment in a bug report (also perhaps give a backtrace, though it might not be very informative). So it seems you are better suited to post such a report. Feel free to link to the upstream bug here.
This bug also happens on x86_64. See ARROW-10912.
Ok, the analysis on the gcc bug report should help us find a workaround.
[~yibocai] [~lausen] Can one of you quickly test the PR above on Aarch64?
